Our literature review
16–18 revealed several CDKIs bearing similar pharmacophoric groups which include two aryl/heterocyclic rings, two carbonyl groups, and a five-membered pyrazole/imidazole core, Figure 1. Among these inhibitors, compound 1 exhibited moderate inhibitory activity against CDK-2 with an IC 50 value of 0.324 μM 15. Compound 1 also exhibited inhibitory activity against CDK-1/4. The study of structure–activity relationship of compound 1 revealed improvement in CDK-2 inhibitory activity on replacement of the ketone oxygen by sulfur
15 .
